compounddef.innerclass: shyft::time_axis::combine_type< T_A, T_B, typename enable_if< T_A::continuous::value &&T_B::continuous::value >::type >

detaileddescription.para: generic test if two different time-axis types resembles the same conceptual time-axis
Given time-axis are of differnt types (point, versus period versus fixed_dt etc.) just compare and see if they produces the same number of periods, and that each period is equal.

Specialization of the equivalent_time_axis given that they are of the same type. In this case we forward the comparison to the type it self relying on the fact that the time_axis it self knows how to fastest figure out if it's equal.

memberdef.name: extend

briefdescription.para: Extend time-axis a with time-axis b.

detaileddescription.para: Values are only added after time-axis a, never inside.

parameterdescription.para: Time-point to split between a and b. If at a interval boundary in a the interval is not included. If inside a interval in a the interval is included. If at a interval boundary in b the interval is included. If inside a interval in b the interval is not included.

merge time-axis a and b into one using merge_info. require a validated merg_info for a and b
a new point_dt where the points are all points of a, plus points of b not covered by a
simple template that merges two equally typed time-series

simplesect.para: the merged time-series, or throws if not compatible

briefdescription.para: The time-axis concept is an important component of time-series. time_axis contains all the definitions of time_axis including the combine algorithms.

detaileddescription.para: definition: time-axis is an ordered sequence of non-overlapping periods
notice: a) the most usual time-axis is the fixed_dt time-axis in the SHyFT core, this is the one we use(could even need a highspeed-nocompromise version)

b) continuous/dense time-axis: there are no holes in total_period types: fixed_dt, calendar_dt, point_dt c) sparse time-axis: there are holes within the span of total_period types: period_list and calendar_dt_p
